subject: RE: [junit] Tradeoff btw. right design and performance
msgSnippet: ... And couldn t you do this with a proxy (say a specialised recordset wrapper), so that you still have the decoupling of fetching information from the DB,
messageBody:
> 2. Non classic solution is to return to a composer a recordset object
> and put on the composer's shoulders to fetch it, surround by specific
> info and put out. This resolves memory wasting problem but tights two
> different activities together.

And couldn't you do this with a proxy (say a specialised recordset
wrapper), so that you still have the decoupling of fetching information
from the DB, from the building of the report. The composer thus still
focuses solely on building a report, whereas the Data Object (my proxy)
can focus on getting data out from a store (DB, filesystem, ...).

> Does it mean that every time a unit test can't be written for a
> function the function must be refactored?

On this one, I will agree with the responses you have already received:
a design that allows for easy unit testing, usually also benefits from
the side-effects of low coupling, high cohesion, etc. You have to
balance the work of undertaking the refactoring, with the benefits: how
long do you expect to be maintaining that function/method; is this a one
off, or further changes are expected for this functionality; ...
